patients.diagnosis: Acute hypoxic respiratory failure due to community-acquired pneumonia

notes.note_text: ED Provider Note: 46M with 4 days fever, productive cough, pleuritic chest pain. SpO2 89% on room air, RR 26. CXR: LLL consolidation. Started ceftriaxone + azithromycin. O2 via NC started, goal SpO2 > 92%. Admit to medicine.
RN Admit Note: Arrived to 4E. On 4L NC, SpO2 93-94% at rest. Reports 7/10 pleuritic pain with deep breath. Dyspneic with talking. Encouraged IS use. MD notified of oxygen requirement on arrival.

Medicine Progress Note: CAP with improving respiratory status. On 2L NC per chart, SpO2 95%. Denies chest pain currently. Continue ceftriaxone/azithro, wean O2 as tolerated. If remains stable, anticipate discharge tomorrow.

RT Assessment: Patient on 4L NC. Resting SpO2 92%. With brief ambulation, SpO2 dropped to 86% and recovered to 92% on 4L after rest. Recommend maintain 4L NC for now and reassess after next neb treatment.

RN Shift Note: Patient remains on 4L NC. Desaturated to 87% when attempting to wean to 2L per earlier plan. Increased work of breathing noted with repositioning. Patient states, "They told me I'm better but I still can't breathe when I move." MD paged.

ED Provider Note: 29F with 2 days fever/chills, dysuria, right flank pain. Vitals: HR 112, BP 118/72, T 38.2C. UA positive nitrites/leuk est. Given IV fluids and ceftriaxone. Plan admit for IV antibiotics and monitoring.
RN Admit Note: Pain improved after meds, now 3/10. Afebrile on arrival. Tolerating PO fluids. No nausea/vomiting. Continue IV antibiotics as ordered.

Medicine Progress Note: Pyelo improving with treatment. Afebrile, HR down to 92. Flank pain improved. Continue IV ceftriaxone today, transition to PO antibiotics tomorrow if stable. Encourage oral intake.
RN Evening Note: Patient comfortable, pain 2/10. Ambulating to bathroom without difficulty. Tolerating diet. Vitals stable.

patients.diagnosis: Small bowel obstruction (SBO) vs ileus, evaluation ongoing

notes.note_text: ED Provider Note: 61F with abdominal pain, nausea, emesis x3 at home, no flatus since yesterday. CT A/P: dilated small bowel with transition point, concern SBO. NPO, IV fluids, pain control. Consult surgery.

Surgery Consult: Exam soft, mild distention, diffuse tenderness without peritoneal signs. Impression: partial SBO. Plan: NPO, NG tube if vomiting persists, serial abdominal exams. No OR today at this time.

RN Note: Patient anxious and states ED doctor told her she would "go to surgery this morning" and wants family called. Continues nausea, requests to drink water. Reinforced NPO, paged team for clarification of plan.
Medicine Progress Note: SBO vs ileus, awaiting surgery recs. Continue NPO, IV fluids. If improves, consider advancing diet later today. Pain and nausea meds PRN.
RN Shift Note: Patient reports worsening abdominal pain 8/10 and increased nausea. HR 116. Abdomen more distended per patient report. No flatus. Team paged for reassessment.
Surgery Re-eval: Patient resting, reports pain improved after meds. Abdomen soft, mild distention. Continue nonoperative management. No OR planned currently.
